course.subject: CENG
course.name: Experiential Learning Initiatives: Prototype Development for Chemical Processes and Products
course.description: This course aims to develop a designed course for chemical engineers via experiential learning approach. The course will involve the development of the "real" prototype via providing various training modules, including the designing of the prototype, the controlling strategy of the small/micro-devices, the computer-programming modules (i.e. Arduino) for the control, and the integration of different mechanical/chemical/electronic modules into one designated project-oriented system, for instance, water purification tank, energy-saving kettle, Chem-E car, and autonomous greywater treatment unit system. It can bring the synergy among the knowledge and such integration will greatly help in the development of practical prototype, which can be applied and widely used in our community.
course.prerequisites: CENG 2110 OR COMP 1021 OR COMP 1022P OR COMP 1022Q OR ELEC 1100 OR ENGG 1100
